title: AI - I. Foundational Framework: The Economic Reality of Internal Information Asymmetry
excerpt: Information Asymmetry: The Economic Reality of Internal Information Asymmetry  is a core management issue where one party has superior data, creating an imbalance. In corporations, this principal-agent problem causes adverse selection (pre-relationship information failures) and unobservable actions (moral hazard), leading to inefficient capital allocation and requiring strict monitoring.

author.name: Data Crusader
author.bio: A seasoned data professional with over 10 years of experience in enterprise data architecture and information asymmetry strategies.
